intro: Picramnia dwyeri, commonly known as the Dwyer's picramnia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are simple and often have a rough texture, while its fruits are small, capsule-like structures. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
